					His august name and immortal feats will always be remembered by mankind, they stressed.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Peruvian Party Leader
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from Peruvian Party Leader

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Tuesday received a message of condolences from Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru.
					
					The message said it expressed the deepest condolences over the demise of respected Marshal Kim Jong Il.
					
					Comrade Kim Jong Il bringing eternal glory to the Korean people and throwing radiant rays to all countries has never passed away, the message said.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from AINDF
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from AINDF

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Tuesday received a message of condolences from the Central Committee of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front. 
					
					The message extended to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il deepest condolences reflecting the bitter grief of the vanguard fighters and other patriotic people from all walks of life in south Korea who are wailing for the loss of the father of the nation. 
					
					General Kim Jong Il who performed immortal exploits before the times and history represented the dignity of Juche Korea and pride of the nation and the banner of national reunification, it said, adding:
					
					With the Songun policy based on patriotism he honorably defended socialism of Juche, a precious legacy of President Kim Il Sung, and turned the DPRK into an invincible politico-ideological power and a matchless military power. 
					
					He advanced the most just and reasonable idea and line of national reunification in every period of the reunification movement and provided the historic Pyongyang summits to give birth to the June 15 joint declaration, landmark for independent reunification, and the October 4 declaration, its action program. 
					
					His was the most brilliant life of a passionate revolutionary, peerless patriot and great man of the world as he devoted his all to the revolutionary cause of Juche and national reunification with the steel-strong guts and superhuman will, holding aloft the red flag of the revolution. 
					
					We will hold you in high esteem as the destiny of the nation, bright sun of guidance to always glorify the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Kim Jong Il for reunification and vigorously advance toward independent reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: S. Korean People Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
S. Korean People Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Upon hearing the sad news that leader Kim Jong Il passed away all of a sudden, more south Koreans from all walks of life are expressing condolences on his demise. 
					
					The headquarters of the movement for withdrawal of the U.S. troops made public a statement on Tuesday expressing deep condolences on so sudden demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission. 
					
					He adopted the June 15 joint declaration, a landmark for national reunification, making a big contribution to the history of the national reunification movement, the statement noted. 
					
					The labor headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions released a joint commentary and message of condolences on the same day. 
					
					They noted that they miss Kim Jong Il more than ever before as he passed away at a time when a great advance was being made in the nationwide movement for independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity in the spirit of "By our nation itself". 
					
					The chairman of the south Korean Federation of Peasants Association said on the same day that there should be urgent efforts for all Koreans to share the present sorrow. He urged the "government" to express condolences together with NGOs in an effort to provide an occasion of inter-Korean reconciliation. 
					
					The Solidarity for Progress in its statement on Monday said that it was expressing deep condolences on the unexpected sad news. The efforts of the nation should be increased in the future to achieve south-north reconciliation and unity and peace and prosperity on the basis of the joint declarations, it stressed.
					
					The South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in its statement on Monday urged the "government" to officially express condolences on the demise of NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il without fail.

articles.title: S. Korean Religious Organization Issues Condolatory Address
articles.content:
S. Korean Religious Organization Issues Condolatory Address

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Buddhist Jogye Order published a condolatory address on Wednesday over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The address expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission.
					
					It extended profound consolation to the compatriots in the north overwhelmed with the great sorrow over the great loss.
					
					It called for promoting dialogue and exchange between the south and the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Calls for Sending Mourners' Group to DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Calls for Sending Mourners' Group to DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The "Forum for Peace on the Korean Peninsula", a civic organization of south Korea, issued a statement for mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il Tuesday.
					
					The statement expressed deep condolences over the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il and extended consolation to the compatriots in the north engulfed in grief.
					
					Kim Jong Il made total dedication to develop the north-south relations of distrust and confrontation into those of reconciliation and cooperation through the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, it said.
					
					It contended that the "government" should express condolences and send mourners' group to the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Civic Organizations Urge Authorities to Send Mourners' Group
articles.content:
S. Korean Civic Organizations Urge Authorities to Send Mourners' Group

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society and the Peace Network of south Korea made public statements on Monday and Tuesday to urge the authorities to send a group of mourners to the DPRK on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The statements praised Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il as the supreme leader of the DPRK who provided two inter-Korean summits. 
					
					They urged the regime to express condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il and send a group of mourners.

articles.title: S. Koreans of Different Circles Call for Mourning Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
S. Koreans of Different Circles Call for Mourning Demise of Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Personages of different circles of south Korea expressed deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Veteran pro-reunification champion Kang Sun Jong, Chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification Ri Kyu Jae, Permanent co-representative of the Solidarity for Progress Ri Kang Sil and Co-representative of the Women's Solidarity of south Korea Son Mi Hui expressed deep condolences over the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					They conveyed the profound condolences to the compatriots in the north stricken with the bitterest sorrow over the great loss to the nation.
					
					Mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il comply with etiquette and obligation, they said, calling upon the "government" and all NGOs to opt for expressing condolences.

articles.title: S. Koean Internet Paper Hopes for Official Expression of Condolences and Sending of Mourners' Group
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Paper Hopes for Official Expression of Condolences and Sending of Mourners' Group

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- South Korean Internet newspaper Saram Ilbo posted an article titled "We express condolences over demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission" on Tuesday as regards his demise.
					
					The article expressed profound condolences over the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il due to a sudden illness.
					
					It praised Kim Jong Il for securing meetings with preceding "presidents" of south Korea for the first time in the history of national division and providing a framework for the development of south-north relations, peace and prosperity through the adoption of the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration which inherited it.
					
					It is quite natural to express condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il and pay a condolatory visit, it noted.
					
					Expressing condolences once again, the article looked forward to the "government's" official expression of condolences and dispatch of mourners' group.

articles.title: Homepages Opened in S. Korea to Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Homepages Opened in S. Korea to Mourn Kim Jong Il′s Demise

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Internet homepages for mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, were opened in south Korea on Dec. 19 when the sad news of his demise was reported, according to south Korean CBS.
					
					Posted on those homepages in succession are articles carrying deep regret of south Koreans at his sudden demise.

articles.title: Article on Kim Jong Il's Greatness Posted on S. Korean Internet Website
articles.content:
Article on Kim Jong Il's Greatness Posted on S. Korean Internet Website

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, an Internet newspaper of south Korea, on Tuesday carried an article a Chinese Han Danshu wrote to praise the greatness of leader Kim Jong Il after his demise.
					
					In the article Han said that he keenly felt Kim Jong Il's gifted extraordinary wisdom and unassuming character while aiding him on a visit to Shanghai, China in 1983. 
					
					During the visit to different parts the leader learned about lots of things, paying deep attention to explanations all the time and showed respect for the revolutionary forerunners including veteran revolutionaries of China familiar with President Kim Il Sung, the article noted, adding:
					
					Though he was in a bad state of health, Kim Jong Il worked hard day and night only for his people before passing away unexpectedly on the way of his field guidance. Then, why could not the Korean people wail over his demise?
					
					They have felt bitter grief at the loss of their leader who took pains for them.
					
					Such feelings come from the fact that he passed away in the course of devotedly working for the people.
					
					The DPRK lost the leader of people and the Chinese people lost their friend.
					
					His revolutionary idea will be everlasting.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il Proposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il Proposed in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification convened a meeting of its Presidium Tuesday upon hearing the sad news that leader Kim Jong Il passed away all of a sudden.
					
					At the meeting the organization set a mourning period ending on Dec. 29 and proposed to the different circles in south Korea to hold a memorial service for Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission.
					
					It also called for forming a non-governmental mourners' group involving personages of political parties and public organizations who support the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					The organization urged the "government" to immediately express condolences and dispatch an official mourners' group and unconditionally allow the non-governmental mourners' group to visit the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Will Stably Develop: Russian Expert
articles.content:
DPRK Will Stably Develop: Russian Expert

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Vorontsov, chief of Section for Korea of the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, in a press interview on Tuesday said as follows:
					
					The demise of leader Kim Jong Il of the DPRK will not have any impact on the principled stand taken by the DPRK at the nuclear talks.
					
					The DPRK will stably develop and no big change would be made in its internal and external policies.
					
					When President Kim Il Sung passed away in 1994, the West blared Kim Jong Il's leading system would last for two years at best.
					
					But he defended the republic.
					
					The present situation is better than that in the mid-1990s.
					
					The DPRK has recorded positive economic development in the recent 10 years.
					
					We don't think there would be any switchover in its domestic and foreign policies.
					
					The successor will be faithful to the objective which had already been set.
					
					The political elites of the DPRK will unite closer around the leader.

articles.title: DPRK Will Overcome Today's Hardship: Swedish Organization
articles.content:
DPRK Will Overcome Today's Hardship: Swedish Organization

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association Monday posted on Internet homepage an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il passed away" with his portrait.
					
					Kim Jong Il devoted his whole life to the cause for the Korean people, the article said, referring to his leadership feats.
					
					Kim Jong Il's demise shocked the Korean people, the article said, adding:
					
					The DPRK will overcome the present difficulties as it is led by Vice-Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Jong Un who remains unfailingly loyal to the cause of Juche, the cause of independence pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and carried forward by Kim Jong Il and there are the Korean people rallied close around Kim Jong Un.
					
					The association expressed the most profound condolences to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people.

articles.title: Demise of Kim Jong Il Is Greatest Loss: Finnish Party Leaders
articles.content:
Demise of Kim Jong Il Is Greatest Loss: Finnish Party Leaders

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, Vice-Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Monday received a message of condolences from Chairman Kalevi Wahrman and General Secretary Heikki Manikko of the Finnish Communists' League on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					The message noted that the demise of General Secretary of the WPK Kim Jong Il is the irretrievable biggest loss to the Korean people and was sad news like a bolt from the blue to the world communists and labor movement. 
					
					It is our firm belief that though Kim Jong Il passed away, his revolutionary cause for independence and Korea's reunification will steadily advance under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, the message said. 
					
					It sincerely hoped that Kim Jong Un would take care of his health and work full of vigor.

articles.title: Korean Revolution Is Invincible: Uruguayan Party Leader
articles.content:
Korean Revolution Is Invincible: Uruguayan Party Leader

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Monday received a message of condolences from Ruben Maria Vera, chairman of the March 26 Movement of Uruguay.
					
					The message said:
					
					Respected Comrade,
					
					I, on behalf of the leadership and all members of the March 26 Movement of Uruguay, express most profound condolences over the demise of respected Comrade Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					At this time of the bitterest sorrow, we extend full solidarity and regards to you and to brothers of the WPK, leaders of the government and all the fraternal people of the DPRK.
					
					It is our belief that the new leadership of the DPRK would reliably give continuity to the great revolutionary cause started by the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung and carried forward by respected Comrade Kim Jong Il.
					
					In addition, we express belief that the fraternal and friendly ties of solidarity between our two parties would continue to expand.
					
					Long live the revolutionary idea of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung!
					
					Eternal glory to the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il.
					
					The Korean revolution is invincible.

articles.title: Foreign Media Report about Koreans Mourning Demise of Their Leader
articles.content:
Foreign Media Report about Koreans Mourning Demise of Their Leader

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Xinhua news of China and ITAR-TASS of Russia on Monday reported about the Korean people mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Xinhua news said:
					
					Streets of Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, were engulfed in bitter grief after the news of demise of Kim Jong Il, supreme leader of the DPRK, was reported on Monday.
					
					That day the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, the National Defence Commission, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK announced a "Notice to all party members, servicepersons and people."
					
					A darkly dressed woman announcer of the DPRK Central TV conveyed in tears and trill the news that Kim Jong Il passed away.
					
					The notice said that "the sudden death of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of our party and people, is the greatest loss to our party and revolution and the bitterest grief to our people and all other Koreans."
					
					The Central TV is airing the news of his demise, documentaries on his revolutionary activities, etc.
					
					Pyongyangites coming and going on streets did not keep back their tears, sharing the bitter grief with each other.
					
					Many citizens and students in Pyongyang gathered in front of the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill to express their deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					Also seen before the statue of the President at Kim Il Sung University, the highest university in the DPRK, were citizens and students lamenting over his demise while expressing condolences.
					
					Flags were flown at half-mast at institutions and schools in mourning for his demise.
					
					The number of vehicles and passersby in streets was far less than at ordinary time.
					
					Traffic controllers on streets were standing guard with tears in their eyes.
					
					ITAR-TASS reported under the title "The Korean people expressing condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il":
					
					The voice of an announcer of the DPRK Central TV informing the news of his demise stopped several times with sobbing.
					
					The Central TV televised people wailing before portraits of their respected leader and mosaics portraying him at different parts of the country.
					
					A woman lamented with words "General! Please, come back to us. It is unbelievable that you left us".
					
					Tens of thousands of citizens in the capital city gathered at the historic sites associated with the leader's exploits to pay tribute to him.
					
					Seen at the statues of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK, were a large number of people grieving with tears in their eyes.
					
					Such voices as "General, don't leave us, please" and "General will always be with us" were heard from among those people one after another.
					
					Servicepersons solemnly pledged to more dynamically advance along the road of revolution indicated by the leader by overcoming sorrow and displaying strength and courage.
					
					Radio and TV are airing in turn dirge, march and patriotic songs and poems praising the undying feats of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The demise of the leader is the greatest loss to the people of the DPRK.
					
					KCNA called upon the people to stand the trial by overcoming sorrow and displaying strength and courage.
					
					It stressed: The Korean people suffered heavy loss but Kim Jong Un, the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche and outstanding leader of our party, army and people, is standing in the van of the Korean revolution. No force on earth can block the revolutionary advance of our party, army and people going under his wise leadership.

articles.title: Feats of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Feats of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Praised Abroad

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Dec. 12 and 14 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					They included seminar and book and photo exhibition in Italy, lectures in the Czech Republic and Guinea and a film show in Thailand.
					
					On display in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and books and photos introducing the Korean people in the efforts to build a prosperous and powerful country and achieve the national reunification.
					
					Mauro Cazadio, general secretary of the Struggle for the Peace and Socialism of Italy, said he pays the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il who performed undying exploits for socialism and human cause of independence by guiding the struggle of the Korean people to victory with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, praised Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, for having reliably ensured the personal safety of the President in the days of anti-Japanese war and the period of building a new country. The Korean people called different regions and units of the country after her august name to hand down her feats to posterity, he said.
					
					Appreciated at the show were "Arms of Korea" and other Korean films.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Party Leader Expresses Solidarity with Songun Cause of DPRK
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Party Leader Expresses Solidarity with Songun Cause of DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Bangladesh, issued a statement on Dec. 15 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					The Songun cause of Juche associated with the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Suk has emerged ever-victorious with Kim Jong Il's assumption of KPA supreme commandership, the chairman said.
					
					The KPA has been further strengthened into the invincible anti-imperialist revolutionary armed forces and the reliable defender of the destiny of the nation and the socialist cause, he added.
					
					The heroic struggle of the army and people of the DPRK standing in the van of the showdown with the U.S. gives great encouragement and hope to the world progressives, he said, expressing firm solidarity with the Songun cause of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversaries Marked
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversaries Marked

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups and articles on the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					The Thai paper Xing San Daily on Dec. 15 carried an article with a portrait of Kim Jong Il. It said that he has trained the KPA to be the army strong in idea and faith and fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique, and consolidated the defence industry as firm as a rock.
					
					It stressed that the achievements made by the army and people of the DPRK in socialist construction are a brilliant fruition of the plan and energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor on Dec. 15 edited articles under the headline "Supreme Commander of DPRK Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk" with photos of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					In an article titled "Supreme commander and military families" the paper said the relations between the supreme commander and military families in the DPRK were like those between the father and his children who share the destiny with the sentiment of kinsmen.
					
					The Nepali paper Arpan on Dec. 16 in an article titled "For women's emancipation all her life" said that Kim Jong Suk, who is praised by the Korean people as anti-Japanese war hero, is an outstanding woman revolutionary.

articles.title: One Million People Visit Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
One Million People Visit Bust of Kim Jong Suk

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Many servicepersons, working people of different strata and school youth and children of the DPRK are visiting the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong with her birth anniversary approaching.
					
					The bust has been visited by at least one million people this year.
					
					Anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and other visitors paid highest tribute to the woman commander of Mt. Paektu, looking back on her brilliant revolutionary life.
					
					Among the visitors were a large number of overseas Koreans and foreigners.

articles.title: Natural Wonders Observed
articles.content:
Natural Wonders Observed

					Pyongyang, December 21 (KCNA) -- Peculiar natural wonders were observed on Mt. Paektu, Jong Il Peak and Tonghung Hill in Hamhung City where the statue of President Kim Il Sung is standing at a time when all Korean people are mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il in bitterest sorrow.
					
					On the morning of Dec. 17 layers of ice were broken on Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu, shaking the lake with big noise.
					
					The Group for Comprehensive Exploration of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu said it was the first time that such big noise was heard from the ridge of Janggun Peak and the lake.
					
					The temperature on Mt. Paektu that day registered 22.4 degrees centigrade below zero and there was strong wind accompanied by snowstorm measuring 18 meters per second.
					
					The snowstorm stopped blowing all of a sudden from dawn of Tuesday and heavy clouds were seen hanging around Hyangdo Peak.
					
					At around 8:05 a.m. the sky began turning red with sunrise on the horizon. The peaks looked like a picture for wide and thick glow.
					
					Kim Jong Il's autographic writings "Mt. Paektu, holy mountain of revolution. Kim Jong Il." carved on the mountain, in particular, were bright with glow.
					
					This phenomenon lasted till 5:00 pm.
					
					Glow was seen atop Jong Il Peak for half an hour from 16:50 on Dec. 19 when the nation was shocked by the news of the leader's demise. This was the first of its kind in dozens of years since the observation of the area was started. 
					
					A natural wonder was also observed around the statue of the President standing on Tonghung Hill.
					
					At around 21:20 Tuesday a Manchurian crane was seen flying round the statue three times before alighting on a tree. The crane stayed there for quite a long while with its head drooped and flew in the direction of Pyongyang at around 22:00.
					
					Observing this, the director of the Management Office for the Hamhung Revolutionary Site, and others said in union that even the crane seemed to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il born of Heaven after flying down there at dead of cold night, unable to forget him."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il vive siempre junto con nosotros
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il vive siempre junto con nosotros

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Las capitalinas plazas donde se instalaron los retratos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il con amplia sonrisa no se vacian por los visitantes que expresan pesame por su deceso.
					
					Viendo la imagen del Dirigente riendose con la chaqueta modesta de campana, los visitantes se agitan en llantos.
					
					El Dirigente paso los dias en el carro o en el tren durmiendo poco y comiendo las bolas de arroz para la prosperidad del pais y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					"!Nuestro General trabajo duro en toda su vida solo para el pueblo!", "Por que nuestro General se fue tan temprano lejos de nosotros", "No hicimos toda la obligacion como poblacion"…
					
					Son las exclamaciones de los habitantes que se suenan en distintos lugares.
					
					En toda su vida el Dirigente compartio las penas y alegrias con el pueblo encontrandose siempre entre este.
					
					Por esta razon, el pueblo llora en llantos y gritan.
					
					El Dirigente no fallecio, sino vive siempre junto con nosotros.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il y su chaqueta de campana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il y su chaqueta de campana

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Ayer han sido instalados los retratos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il con amplia sonrisa en varios puntos de esta capital, inclusive la Plaza Kim Il Sung y la explanada frente al Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang.
					
					Los uniformados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los trabajadores de diferentes sectores, los jovenes y ninos escolares acuden sin parar a esos lugares.
					
					Lo que les hace romper a llorar es la chaqueta modesta que lleva el Dirigente en su retrato.
					
					Durante toda su vida de dirigente, el siempre se vestia de esa ropa, nombrada por los coreanos como chaqueta de campana.
					
					En aquella vestimenta, el Dirigente inspecciono el Puesto de Pinos, los otros en el frente como los montes Osong y Taedok, Phanmunjom, etc. para defender el destino independiente y el futuro del pueblo y visito incontables fabricas, empresas y granjas cooperativas para conducir al pueblo a la senda de triunfo. 
					
					Gracias a la abnegacion del Dirigente por el pueblo, se defiende firmemente la RPDC donde se transforman como paraiso socialista las ciudades y aldeas y se aumentan las riquezas del pueblo.

articles.title: Guia en el terreno de Kim Jong Il no paro aun en los dias de intenso frio
articles.content:
Guia en el terreno de Kim Jong Il no paro aun en los dias de intenso frio

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El dolor del pueblo coreano por el deceso del Dirigente     Kim Jong Il se hizo mas fuerte al conocerse los datos meteorologicos de cuando el realizo sus ultimas actividades revolucionarias.
					
					El dia 16, cuando el continuo su marcha forzada de orientacion luego de recorrer el Centro de Informacion de Musica Hana y el Supermercado del Area de Kwangbok en esta capital, en la mayoria de la extension geografica del pais, el viento se desplazaba a una velocidad de 5-6 m por segundo y en algunas zonas interiores del norte, a 16 m por segundo como maximo.
					
					La temperatura maxima de la tarde marcaba 6-9oC menos que la promedia, o sea, la mas baja desde el ano 1985.
					
					Y en los mares Este y Oeste se hacia un viento fuerte de 10-15m/s y se produjeron las oleadas de 2-3 m de altura.
					
					La temperatura de la manana del dia 17, en que estaba el Dirigente a bordo del tren para la visita de orientacion, bajo 4-7oC mas que la promedia, marcando asi la mas baja de los dias invernales de este ano transcurridos hasta ahora.
					
					Los meteorologos dicen que el Dirigente realizo sus visitas de orientacion sin hacer caso de las condiciones climaticas adversas como frio penetrante, lluvias y nevadas.  
					
					Aseguran que gracias a los esfuerzos abnegados del Dirigente quien protegio al pueblo de todos los vientos y mareas de la historia, nuestra patria se convertira sin falta en el Estado prospero socialista.

articles.title: Juran en Palacio Memorial Kumsusan seguir guia de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Juran en Palacio Memorial Kumsusan seguir guia de Kim Jong Un

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Se incrementa el numero de los que acuden al Palacio Memorial Kumsusan donde esta conservado el feretro del difunto Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Ellos se atormentan por el fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					"!Presidente Kim Il Sung! Nosotros crecimos como los funcionarios bajo el cuidado de usted y la confianza del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, pero no cumplimos la obligacion moral de discipulos y soldados", dijo la viceministra de Industria Metalurgica, O Hi Sun (56 anos de edad) ante el retrato del Presidente con amplia sonrisa colocado en la pared frontal del palacio.
					
					El oficial del Ejercito Popular de Corea Nam Chol Song (47 anos de edad) senalo que el Dirigente vive siempre entre los uniformados del EPC y juro apoyar con el fusil la direccion del vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jong Un, quien iguala al Comandante Supremo.
					
					El jefe del taller de la Fabrica de Alambres Electricos 326 de Pyongyang, Mun Myong Chol (52 anos de edad) apunto que el vicepresidente         Kim Jong Un es el destino y futuro de Corea y manifesto su conviccion de que bajo la guia del vicepresidente, Corea lograra sin falta la causa de construir un Estado prospero y la de reunificar la patria que deseaba tanto el Presidente Kim Il Sung y que preparo el Dirigente.

articles.title: Sigue expresando condolencias a Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Sigue expresando condolencias a Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Numerosos coreanos visitaron el dia 20 el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan donde esta conservado el cuerpo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Entraron con lagrimas en el lugar de ceremonia de condolencias los oficiales y los soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los trabajadores de distintos estratos, los jovenes y  estudiantes.
					
					Ante el feretro del Dirigente se veian las charreteras de mariscal de la RPDC, las Ordenes       Kim Il Sung, el Premio Kim Il Sung, las medallas de Heroe de la Republica y de Heroe del Trabajo y otras ordenes y medallas.
					
					Al lado del feretro estaba colocada una ofrenda floral enviada por Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					En medio de la interpretacion del canto funebre,  fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales en nombre del Comite Estatal de Ciencias y Tecnicas, los Ministerios de Industria Electronica, de Construccion e Industria de Materiales de Construccion, de Transporte Terrestre y Maritimo y de Agricultura, la Editora del Periodico Rodong Sinmun, la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea, el Comite de Radio y Television de Corea, la Universidad Kim Il Sung, la Fabrica de Alambres Electricos 326 de Pyongyang, las unidades del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, etc.
					
					Ellos guardaron un momento de silencio recordando con gran emocion la vida revolucionaria del gran hombre sin igual quien dedico todo lo suyo para la patria y el pueblo.

articles.title: Habitantes coreanos juran apoyar con sinceridad a Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Habitantes coreanos juran apoyar con sinceridad a Kim Jong Un

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Enterados  de la noticia del fallecimiento del Dirigente       Kim Jong Il por la enfermedad aguda, los habitantes de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte estan entristecidos con llantos anorando al padre de la nacion.
					
					Citado por la ACNC el gerente del Complejo de Maquinaria de Rakwon, Pak Jong Gun (65 anos de edad) dijo:
					
					En julio pasado el Dirigente vino a nuestro complejo, cuando evaluo altamente los exitos y dio la tarea de producir en el futuro gran cantidad de mejores maquinas necesarias a varias ramas de la economia nacional.
					
					Pero, nunca pensamos en que la ensenanza del Dirigente se convirtiera en el legado.
					
					Los funcionarios y obreros de Rakwon tienen la decision de quedar fieles a la direccion del vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Jong Un, al convertir la tristeza de hoy en las fuerzas y el animo y dar salto en la produccion de maquinas modernas.
					
					La presidenta de la Junta Administrativa de la Granja Cooperativa de Sin-am del distrito de Ryongchon, Kim Yong Sun (57 anos de edad) dijo que no puede contener la tristeza al enterarse de  que el Dirigente fallecio en el tren por la fatiga mental y fisica.

articles.title: Ciudadanos sienten remordimiento por deceso de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Ciudadanos sienten remordimiento por deceso de Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- No puedo ver la imagen con amplia sonrisa del Dirigente    Kim Jong Il puesta en la plaza del Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang por el remordimiento de no haber hecho la responsabilidad de un funcionario ni la obligacion de un soldado.
					
					Dijo asi el director del citado Palacio Jon Yong Gun, (52 anos de edad).
					
					Sus palabras reflejan el sentimiento de los ciudadanos por no haber levantado ninguna estatua de bronce del Dirigente.
					
					Por lo tanto, las imagenes de amplia sonrisa del Dirigente con la sencilla chaqueta fueron puestas en la Plaza Kim Il Sung, la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril y otros lugares de esta ciudad para expresar las condolencias.
					
					"?Como puede irse sin nosotros?", "No se vaya, por favor" y otros gritos con llantos desgarran los corazones de las personas.
					
					La diputada a la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Thak Hwa Suk (49 anos de edad) subrayo que el Dirigente no se fue de nosotros y agrego que es muy doloroso el hecho de que no se ha levantado ni una estatua de bronce del Dirigente quien hizo todo lo posible haciendo la marcha penosa solo para la felicidad del pueblo y nos dispensaba todas las benevolencias.
					
					El veterano de guerra, Sin Myong Chol (77 anos de edad), morador en el barrio de Sokbong del municipio de Sosong dijo:
					
					Cada vez que veia en la TV al Dirigente siempre sonriente quien realizaba la visita de orientacion dia y noche tomando el tren por la felicidad del pueblo pense que el era siempre sano y salvo. Nunca me imagine que nuestro Dirigente padecia de una  enfermedad  tan grave.
					
					Dicen que hay que pagar la benevolencia, pero no lo hice y solo la recibi. Me siento remordimiento por el respecto.
					
					La alumna de la Escuela Secundaria de Pongji de Pyongyang, Ri Un Sim (15 anos de edad) dijo gimoteando:
					
					Yo esperaba tanto el primer dia del ano nuevo para mostrarle a nuestro Padre Dirigente la funcion por el ano nuevo para que el se sintiera alegre y satisfecho. Pero ahora, no puedo ofrecerle la funcion.

articles.title: Coreanos anoran al Dirigente

Coreanos anoran al Dirigente

					Alli los coreanos anoran con lagrimas al Dirigente con el sentimiento de sublime veneracion.
					
					La tejedora del taller combinado de la tejedura de la Fabrica Textil de Pyongyang, Mun Kang Sun (29 anos de edad) dijo:
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il me presento a mi, obrera ordinaria, como vanguardia de la epoca conocida por  todo el mundo.
					
					Yo naci como hija postuma, por lo tanto, cuando me encontre con el Dirigente le llame como padre. Al  fallecer inesperadamente mi padre, no se que decir.
					
					Tambien los obreros de la Fabrica de Alambres Electricos 326 de Pyongyang expresan sentidas condolencias al Padre de la nacion en el lugar de ceremonia de condolencias.
					
					El gerente Kim Sok Nam (49 anos de edad) no contuvo lagrimas diciendo que recuerda vividamente al Dirigente, quien al visitar su fabrica se mostro muy satisfecho de que se hayan acondicionado merecidamente a la altura de la epoca del Songun los procesos de produccion, la cultura laboral y la de vida.
					
					Entrevistado con la ACNC en la sede de ceremonia de condolencias situada en el Instituto de Ciencia de Verduras de Pyongyang, el director de la Direccion de Floricultura de Pyongyang, Kong Tok Chang (57 anos de edad) dijo:
					
					El Dirigente, al visitar este lugar, evaluo  nuestro exito aunque sea pequeno. Nos decidimos a darle mayor alegria, pero nuestro Dirigente fallecio inesperadamente. No puedo contener el sentimiento doloroso.
					
					Al lugar de ceremonia de condolencias en la Universidad Kim Il Sung acuden incesantemente numerosos estudiantes, militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea y habitantes de distintos estratos.
					
					El investigador de la facultad de economia de dicha universidad, Ri Kyong Yong (70 anos de edad) destaco que durante decenios desde cuando empezo  a trabajar de profesor en el centro supremo de la educcion autoctona crecio como profesor y doctor titulares gracias a la confianza y el amor del Dirigente y recibio la mesa del cumpleanos 70 enviada por este.
					
					Agrego que no podia olvidarse de la gran benevolencia del Dirigente.
					
					Y tomo decision de apoyar siempre a Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.

articles.title: Cuadros directivos chinos expresan condolencias en embajada coreana
articles.content:
Cuadros directivos chinos expresan condolencias en embajada coreana

					Pyongyang, 21 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China Wen Jiabao expreso el dia 21 condolencias en la embajada coreana en su pais  junto con el presidente del Comite Nacional de la Conferencia Consultiva Politica del Pueblo Chino Jia Qinglin, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la RPCh Li Keqiang, el secretario de la Comision Central para Disciplina e Inspeccion He Guoqiang y el secretario de la Comision Central de Politicas y Ley Zhou Yongkang quienes son los miembros del Comite Permanente del BP del CC del PCCh.
					
					Lo hicieron tambien el consejero de Estado y secretario general del Consejo de Estado Ma Kai, el consejero de Estado Dai Bingguo, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el alcalde del Gobierno Popular de la ciudad de Beijing Guo Jinlong, el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad del Pueblo Chino con el Extranjero Li Xiaolin y el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea Wu Donghe.
					
					Fueron depositadas ante el retrato del Dirigente Kim Jong Il las ofrendas flores en nombre de Wen Jiabao, Jia Qinglin, Li Keqiang, He Guoqiang y Zhou yongkang.
					
					Tambien fueron colocadas las ofrendas florales en nombre del ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, el ministerio de Defensa Nacional, el ministerio de Comercio, el ministerio de Cultura, el gobierno popular de la ciudad de Beijing, la Federacion Nacional de Sindicatos de China, el CC de la Liga de la Juventud Comunista de China, la Federacion Nacional de Mujeres de China, la Asociacion de Amistad del Pueblo Chino con el Extranjero y la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea.
					
					Ante el retrato del Dirigente los cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado de China hicieron reverencia tres veces para expresar las sentidas condolencias.
					
					Wen Jiabao expreso la tristeza por el fallecimiento del Dirigente y el consuelo sincero al pueblo coreano.
					
					El dijo que el camarada Kim Jong Il fue el gran dirigente del partido y el Estado de Corea y amigo intimo del pueblo chino e hizo gran aporte al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion durante largo tiempo.
					
					Expreso la voluntad del partido y el gobierno de China de esforzarse de continuo por consolidar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad de los dos paises junto con el partido y el gobierno de Corea.
					
					Estoy seguro de que el pueblo coreano impulsara con mas vigor la construccion socialista bajo la direccion del camarada Kim Jong Un, dijo Li Keqiang.
					
					Zhou Yongkang dijo que el pueblo chino no olvidara siempre al camarada Kim Jong Il.
					
					Dai Bingguo destaco que no imagino el deceso inesperado del Dirigente y expreso las sentidas condolencias.
					
					El hecho de que todos los miembros del Comite Permanente del BP del CC del PCCh visitaron la embajada coreana para expresar sus condolencias constituye el maximo homenaje del colectivo de la direccion central de China al Dirigente y el invariable apoyo del partido y el pueblo de China  al Partido del Trabajo de Corea y al pueblo coreano.
